readme:
# Robot Control

## What is it?
This project is a robot control client/server application mainly for Raspberry Pi with [Raspbian](https://www.raspberrypi.org/downloads/raspbian), that you can  [test also on PC/Mac](#testing-on-pc-and-mac)

Sources of client web application can be found [here](https://github.com/SaboteurSpk/robot-control-client)

### Under the hood
This project is build on top of [NodeJS](https://nodejs.org), [React](https://facebook.github.io/react), [MobX](https://mobx.js.org/), [Socket.IO](https://socket.io/)

## Status of project
Early alpha version (usable but hard to install and configure)

## Sources and issue tracking
Going to be published on GitHub soon

## Where can I find some support?
Meet me at [Slack](https://join.slack.com/robot-control-support/shared_invite/MjA0NDc0Njk0NTMwLTE0OTg1OTM5NjQtYmZhYTczZmJjZQ) channel in day hours (central european time). 
## Installation

### Prerequisities
1. Install [Raspbian](https://www.raspberrypi.org/documentation/installation/installing-images)
2. on PI 2 or 3 install [NodeJS 8](https://nodejs.org/en/download/package-manager/#debian-and-ubuntu-based-linux-distributions)  or on PI 1 [uninstall NodeJS and install new NodeJS](https://raspberrypi.stackexchange.com/questions/48303/install-nodejs-for-all-raspberry-pi) (replace node-v6.2.1-linux-armv6l.tar.gz with some 8 version from https://nodejs.org/dist)
3. Install [Pi Blaster](https://github.com/sarfata/pi-blaster) from [sources](https://github.com/sarfata/pi-blaster#build-and-install-directly-from-source) that you clone to some directory:
```shell
git clone https://github.com/sarfata/pi-blaster
```
### Install and run main package
```shell
sudo npm install -g robot-control
robot-control
```
Open the application on port 3100 in state of art browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) (use Chrome on Android device)

# Testing on PC and Mac
1. Install NodeJS for your OS from [NodeJS](https://nodejs.org)
2. Install main package from command line
```shell
npm install -g robot-control
```
or
```shell
sudo npm install -g robot-control
```
3. Run main package
```shell
robot-control
```
4. Open the application on port 3100 in state of art browser (Chrome, Firefox, Safari) (use Chrome on Android device)

# Future work
## Documentation for UI and UI programming
Without documentation nobody is able to create his own UI :(

## Support for customization of UI
Custom backgrounds, more controls like buttons, sliders etc.
## Support for I2C

In near future (few weeks) this project should start to support I2C bus and [Adafruit PWM Board](https://www.adafruit.com/product/815) that you can buy for few dollars on [Aliexpress](https://www.aliexpress.com/wholesale?catId=0&initiative_id=SB_20170627113451&SearchText=16-Channel+12-bit+PWM%2FServo+Driver+I2C) o eBay.
